wikipedia_page.main: Sir Clive Bossom, 2nd Baronet,  (4 February 1918 – 8 March 2017) was a British Conservative politician and Member of Parliament (MP).

response: Despite the opposition of many of the population of Herefordshire, neither of the county's two Conservative MPs opposed the merger. Parliamentary opposition had to be led from outside the county by Terry Davis, MP for Bromsgrove, who noted that the petition had been signed by 60,000 people. Clive Bossom, the MP for Leominster in Herefordshire, supported the merger, noting that "much of South Worcestershire is very like Herefordshire".
